text: Game over, candidate. Try another campaign cycle.
Better luck in the next election year.
The polls have closed… but not in your favor.
Your opponent kissed more babies.
You’ve reached term limits… of stamina.
You’ve dropped out to spend more time with your family.
Your staff quit mid-race.
Your slogan didn’t stick this time.
Scandal fatigue got you this time.
Lobbyists pulled the plug.
Your campaign funds dried up.
You lost the debate… and the race.
You’ve been redistricted out of existence.
Your campaign promises expired mid-stride.
No matter how far you run, the finish line keeps moving.
Democracy has left the chat.
Your approval rating just tanked.
The race is rigged, and you’re not the favorite.
You filibustered yourself out of the game.
The voters ran faster than you.
PAC money only carried you so far.
Your donors cashed out — and so did you.
The swamp doesn’t drain itself.
The lobbyists thank you for your service.
The lobbyists found a shinier puppet.
Money talked. Voters walked.
You were out-bribed at the finish line.
Your district finally realized you never lived there.
Your constituents voted… with their feet.
You ignored the town hall once too often.
The people wanted change. You gave them pocket change.
Even your base stopped holding their noses.
Scandal fatigue isn’t a platform.
You drowned in a swamp of your own making.
The slime trail you left was too slippery to run on.
You couldn’t filibuster your way out of corruption charges.
Turns out Bought & Sold wasn’t a great campaign brand.
Your approval rating was negative before you fell.
Congratulations, you successfully represented… nobody.
